definition: Rabindranath Tagore (1861-1941), Indian poet and writer
Mt Tai 泰山[Tai4 Shan1] in Shandong/abbr. for Thailand
safe/peaceful/most/grand
dagger-axe/abbr. for 戈瑞[ge1 rui4]/(Tw) abbr. for 戈雷[ge1 lei2]
surname Ge
variant of 爾|尔[er3]
thus/so/like that/you/thou

sentences.english: Intellectuals in Beijing University even gave a Chinese name to Rabindranath Tagore.
sentences.chinese: 北京大学的教授甚至给泰戈尔取了中文名字。

sentences.english: Perhaps both of Tagore and Zhang are inarticulate people.
sentences.chinese: 也许张小娴和泰戈尔都是不善于表达的人。

sentences.english: India's national anthem ‘the Will of the People’ was composed by Tagore.
sentences.chinese: 印度国歌《人民的意志》就是泰戈尔创作的。

sentences.english: Tagore is pictured with China's last emperor Pu Yi in 1924.
sentences.chinese: 有1924年泰戈尔和末代皇帝溥仪的合影。

sentences.english: The relationship between man and God is the centre of his artistic view.
sentences.chinese: 人神关系是泰戈尔艺术观的中心。

sentences.english: Besides Tagore, we Chinese always think of Buddhism.
sentences.chinese: 除了泰戈尔，我们还会想到佛教。

sentences.english: From the Tagore's poem, the love between bird and fish is the furtherest distance.
sentences.chinese: 从泰戈尔的诗中，飞鸟和鱼的距离是最远的。

sentences.english: This scene was in the same area as the Tagore House, where poet Rabindranath Tagore was born. Photograph by Dilip Mehta
sentences.chinese: 这幕场景就发生于诗人泰戈尔故居所处的同一地区。

sentences.english: Rabindranath Tagore called it a teardrop glistening on the cheek of time.
sentences.chinese: 泰戈尔称它是时代面颊上的一颗晶莹的泪珠。

sentences.english: Mr. Tan Chung gave a briefing of the book and a retrospection of Tagore and his visits to China.
sentences.chinese: 谭中对该书做了介绍并回顾了泰戈尔及其访华故事。

sentences.english: Do you know about Tagore in India?
sentences.chinese: 那您对印度的泰戈尔了解吗？

sentences.english: Footnote 1: Rathi, his son, was then five years old.
sentences.chinese: 拉西，泰戈尔的儿子，那时五岁。

sentences.english: Take two hours of aircraft, has finally arrived at the Berlin tagore airport.
sentences.chinese: 乘了2个小时的飞机，终于到达了柏林泰戈尔机场。

sentences.english: Tagore is also well-known to every household In China. He visited China in 1924.
sentences.chinese: 在中国，泰戈尔可以说是家喻户晓。

sentences.english: "Gitanjali" is one of the most outstanding works by Tagore, a well-known Indian poet.
sentences.chinese: 《吉檀迦利》是印度著名诗人泰戈尔的杰出代表作。

sentences.english: Rabindranath Tagore paid a grand visit to China in 1924.

definition: Alexandr Sergeevich Pushkin (1799-1837), great Russian romantic poet
Khalil Gibran (1883-1931), Lebanese poet, writer and artist
Tolstoy (name)/Count Lev Nikolayevich Tostoy (1828-1910), great Russian novelist, author of War and Peace 戰爭與和平|战争与和平
Shelley/abbr. for 珀西·比希·雪萊|珀西·比希·雪莱[Po4 xi1 · Bi3 xi1 · Xue3 lai2]
George Bernard Shaw (1856-1950), Irish dramatist and writer
George Byron (1788-1824), English poet
Ivan Sergeevich Turgenev (1818-1883), Russian novelist
Heinrich Heine (1797-1856), German lyric poet
Tolstoy (name)/Count Lev Nikolayevich Tostoy (1828-1910), great Russian novelist, author of War and Peace 戰爭與和平|战争与和平
pinyin: Lie4 fu1 · Tuo1 er3 si1 tai4

definition: Jorge Luis Borges
Gustave Flaubert (1821-1880), French realist novelist, author of Madame Bovary
Voltaire (1694-1778), Enlightenment philosopher
Mark Twain (Samuel Langhorne Clemens 1835-1910), US writer, novelist and humorist, author of Adventures of Huckleberry Finn 哈克貝利·芬歷險記|哈克贝利·芬历险记[Ha1 ke4 bei4 li4 · Fen1 Li4 xian3 Ji4]
Honoré de Balzac (1799-1850), French novelist, author of series La comédie humaine
Fyodor Mikhailovich Dostoevsky (1821-1881), great Russian novelist, author of Crime and Punishment 罪與罰|罪与罚[Zui4 yu3 Fa2]
pinyin: Tuo2 si1 tuo3 ye1 fu1 si1 ji1

definition: Shakespeare (name)/William Shakespeare (1564-1616), poet and playwright
